Class Easter

java.lang.Object
Easter
public class Easter
extends java.lang.Object
The main purpose of this class is to take in a year and compute the date that Easter occurred/will occur on that year.
Since:
8/28/2021
Author:
Tucker Dickson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int day
    This private instance variable represents the day that Easter occurs on a given year; set by computeEaster()
    private int month
    This private instance variable represents the month that Easter occurs on a given year; set by computeEaster()
    private int year
    This private instance variable represents the year that will be used to calculate Easter; passed by the user

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Easter​(int year)
    This is the sole constructor for the Easter class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void computeEaster()
    This method uses the Meeus/Jones/Butcher algorithm to calculate the date of Easter given a specific year.
    int getDay()
    This method acts as the 'getter' for the day instance variable.
    int getMonth()
    This method acts as the 'getter' for the month instance variable.
    int getYear()
    This method acts as the 'getter' for the year instance variable.
    void printEaster()
    This method simply prints uses the day, month, and year instance variables to print out the date of Easter, following the format below: Easter: Month Day, Year
    void setDay​(int day)
    This is the setter method for the day instance variable.
    void setMonth​(int month)
    This is the setter method for the month instance variable.
    void setYear​(int year)
    This method acts as the 'setter' for the year instance variable, as well as day and month indirectly.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • day

      private int day
      This private instance variable represents the day that Easter occurs on a given year; set by computeEaster()

    • month

      private int month
      This private instance variable represents the month that Easter occurs on a given year; set by computeEaster()

    • year

      private int year
      This private instance variable represents the year that will be used to calculate Easter; passed by the user

  • Constructor Details

    • Easter

      public Easter​(int year)
      This is the sole constructor for the Easter class. It takes an int called year as a parameter and uses it to set the year instance variable. It then calls the computeEaster method to compute and set the day and month instance variables.
      Parameters:
      year - This represents the year that will be used to compute the date of Easter. It will be used to set the year instance variable.

  • Method Details

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      This method acts as the 'getter' for the day instance variable. It simply returns the int day.
      Returns:
      This function returns an int that represents the day that Easter occurs on a specific year

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()
      This method acts as the 'getter' for the month instance variable. It simply returns the int month.
      Returns:
      This function returns an int that represents the month that Easter occurs on a specific year

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      This method acts as the 'getter' for the year instance variable. It simply returns the int year.
      Returns:
      This function returns an int that represents a year, previously set by the user.

    • setDay

      public void setDay​(int day)
      This is the setter method for the day instance variable. This method is not used currently.
      Parameters:
      day - This parameter represents the day that will be used to set the day instance variable

    • setMonth

      public void setMonth​(int month)
      This is the setter method for the month instance variable. This method is not used currently.
      Parameters:
      month - This parameter represents the month that will be used to set the month instance variable

    • setYear

      public void setYear​(int year)
      This method acts as the 'setter' for the year instance variable, as well as day and month indirectly. The method takes in an int called year as a parameter and uses it to set the year instance variable. It then calls the computeEaster(), which uses the year instance variable to compute the date of Easter on that year, and set the day and month instance variables.
      Parameters:
      year - This parameter represents the year that the user wants to compute the date of Easter for

    • computeEaster

      public void computeEaster()
      This method uses the Meeus/Jones/Butcher algorithm to calculate the date of Easter given a specific year. It uses the year instance variable to do this, and sets the day and month instance variables once it's computed the date.

    • printEaster

      public void printEaster()
      This method simply prints uses the day, month, and year instance variables to print out the date of Easter, following the format below: Easter: Month Day, Year
